polished_script:
HOOK: You hit top 1% and you're still losing everything that matters. [ON-SCREEN: Top 1% â‰  Winning]

BRAND INTRO: "This is D.J. Paris with Keeping It Real Podcast, and this is your agent tip of the day."

SETUP: You're crushing your production goals, but missing your kid's games. You're the top agent in your office, but your marriage is hanging by a thread. You're making great money, but you haven't taken a real day off in two years. [ON-SCREEN: Success at What Cost?]

[15-SEC RE-HOOK]: But here's what Garrett Maroon figured out at 47 transactions that changed everything.

INSIGHT: Most agents chase a success formula they didn't even write. Garrett Maroon built a top 1% business in Southeast Virginia, then did something radical: he fired 60% of his database. [ON-SCREEN: Fired 60% of Database] Just stopped chasing C and D clients. Hired a $15-an-hour showing assistant. Built iron boundaries: no calls after 6pm, no Sunday showings. [ON-SCREEN: No Calls After 6pm] His volume dropped from 47 deals to 32 the next year. But he coached every single one of his son's baseball games and made more per transaction working with A-clients who actually valued his time. [ON-SCREEN: 32 Deals = More Profit]

REFRAME: You can be the top producer in your market and still be failing at the life you actually want. The breakthrough isn't doing more deals â€” it's getting clear on what you're building toward and having the guts to cut what doesn't fit.

CTA: "Open your client list right now â€” how many people on there drain your energy and give nothing back?"

CLOSE: "See you next time."

---

CAPTION: Top 1% agent fired 60% of his database and made MORE money working fewer hours. Here's exactly what he did ðŸ‘‡

HASHTAGS: #RealEstate #WorkLifeBalance #TopProducer #RealEstateSuccess #AgentTips

SHAREABLE_MOMENT: "You can be the top producer in your market and still be failing at the life you actually want."

PERFORMANCE_NOTES: 
1. Deliver hook with genuine concern, not celebration â€” pause after "top 1%" 
2. Speed up during the statistics (47 to 32 deals) but slow down on "coached every single game"
3. Look directly into camera during the reframe â€” this is the money quote

_metadata.rewrite_changelog: Replaced vague 'maybe success is...' examples with Garrett's actual story: firing 60% of database, hiring showing assistant, setting 6pm boundary. Changed reflective CTA ('write it down tonight') to concrete action: identify 3 draining clients and refer them out tomorrow morning. Built entire INSIGHT around one specific decision and its measurable outcome.
_metadata.judge_note: Too vague and self-helpyâ€”give one concrete example of what Garrett ACTUALLY changed in his business (a system, a boundary, a hire) instead of asking viewers to journal.
